title: Overlay Strava Data on Your Ride Videos with Streiv App
content:
Want to spice up your social media posts with your Strava stats? 

A new app called Streiv allows users to record and share their Strava rides without a camera or software. The app, which launched in March, can quickly synchronize Strava data with users’ videos, allowing them to track performance while offering fun videos.

Available data includes speed, wattage, and heart rate. Once added to a video, users can share it to social media platforms directly from the app. Streiv supports both horizontal and vertical video recording, and it’s compatible with all iOS devices, including iPhones and iPads.

“Streiv was born out of the desire to create a user-friendly, accessible app that makes it easier to show Strava data on videos,” Lucas den Otter, founder of Streiv, said on the website. 

Streiv is now available in the Apple App Store. Check out Streiv’s Instagram account (above) for more examples of created videos.
